snippet: Defense officials said they failed to recognize the scope of the reports from Americans who served in Iraq, or to offer them adequate care.
abstract: Defense officials say they failed to recognize scope of reported cases of American service members being exposed to chemical warfare agents in Iraq, or to offer adequate tracking and treatment plans; more than 600 service members now report encountering such weapons since 2003, tally suggesting that others, including Iraqi troops and civilians, may also have been at risk from exposure to chemical agents.
lead_paragraph: Defense officials said they failed to recognize the scope of the reports from Americans who served in Iraq, or to offer them adequate care.

headline.main: More Than 600 Reported Chemical Exposure in Iraq, Pentagon Acknowledges
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Reveals Greater Exposure to Chemical Arms

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
